text: Purpose - Provide R/HTMLWidgets/Shiny interface JS orthogonal viewer. - Serialize R volume objects (neuroim2) format consumable neuroimjs. - Expose simple, chainable R API adding layers adjusting visual parameters. Key pieces - Widget constructor - ortho_viewer(bg_volume, bg_colormap = "greys", ...) - Accepts 3D background volume (likely neuroim2). - Serializes JSON‑friendly spec: - dim, data, spacing, origin, axes. - Passes JS htmlwidget binding. - Shiny bindings - ortho_viewerOutput(id, width, height) - renderOrtho_viewer(expr, ...) - Standard htmlwidgets output/render functions. - Proxy API - ortho_proxy(outputId, session) → R6 OrthoViewerProxy methods: - add_layer(vol, id = NULL, thresh, range, colormap, opacity) - set_window(range, layer_id = NULL) - set_threshold(thresh, layer_id = NULL) - set_colormap(colormap, layer_id = NULL) - set_opacity(alpha, layer_id = NULL) - method packages arguments JSON message calls: - session$sendCustomMessage("ortho-viewer-command", msg). - Volume serialization helpers - Functions convert neuroim2 volumes arrays JS‑friendly payload: - Dimensions voxel values. - Optional spacing, origin, orientation axes. Files (expected) - R/ortho_viewer.R – widget constructor Shiny bindings. - R/ortho_proxy.R – R6 proxy class helper. - inst/htmlwidgets/ortho_viewer.js – JS binding DOM integration. - inst/htmlwidgets/ortho_viewer.css – optional shell styling.

Purpose - Implement actual rendering interaction: - 3‑pane orthogonal image viewer. - Layer management blending. - Thresholding, windowing, colormaps. - Sidebar control panel (<layer-control-panel>). Key classes / components - Core volume types - NeuroSpace, DenseNeuroVol (related types). - Define dimensionality, voxel data, spacing, origin, axes. - Layering - VolLayer – wraps single volume visual properties: - Range/window ([min, max]), threshold ([low, high]), opacity, colormap. - VolStack – collection VolLayers. - ImageLayer – façade VolStack viewer consumption, including: - addLayer(), getLayerIds(), updateLayer(), etc. - Viewer - OrthogonalImageViewer - Renders axial, coronal, sagittal slices grid. - Supports "left-tall" layout: - Axial left spanning vertical. - Coronal (top-right) sagittal (bottom-right). - Takes { container, imageLayer, options } create(). - Colormaps & thresholds - ColorMap buildLookupTable(): - Uses threshold interval semantics: - Values < low > high → opaque. - low < value < high → transparent (alpha = 0). - Supports multiple presets (viridis, magma, inferno, cividis, greys, etc.). - Control panel - LayerControlPanelLit.ts → <layer-control-panel> (LitElement): - Active layer selection. - Colormap dropdown. - Window range control (range slider). - Threshold low/high controls. - Alpha/opacity slider. - Hooks imageLayer volLayer API (R involvement). Htmlwidget integration expectations - htmlwidget factory orthoviewer : - Create DOM shell: - Sidebar <layer-control-panel>. - Viewer container OrthogonalImageViewer. - Construct volumes layers R‑provided specs: - Background volume → VolLayer. - Overlay layers added via commands (add-layer). - Create ImageLayer/VolStack OrthogonalImageViewer. - Inject imageLayer <layer-control-panel>: - panel.imageLayer = imageLayer; - panel.requestUpdate();

code: library(shiny) library(orthoviewer)  ui <- fluidPage(   ortho_viewerOutput("viewer", height = "600px") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$viewer <- renderOrtho_viewer({     ortho_viewer(brain, bg_colormap = "Greys")   })    # Add overlay via proxy   observe({     p <- ortho_proxy("viewer", session)     p$add_layer(stat_map, id = "stats", thresh = c(-2, 2), colormap = "hot")   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Introduction to orthoviewer
text: ortho_proxy() object lets control viewer R:
code: p <- ortho_proxy("viewer", session)  # Navigate to coordinates (with smooth animation) p$set_crosshair(c(32, -20, 45), animate = TRUE)  # Adjust overlay appearance p$set_threshold(c(-3, 3), layer_id = "stats") p$set_colormap("viridis", layer_id = "stats") p$set_opacity(0.5, layer_id = "stats")  # Toggle visibility p$hide_layer("stats") p$show_layer("stats")  # Reorder layers (first = bottom, last = top) p$set_layer_order(c("background", "mask", "stats"))  # Remove a layer p$remove_layer("stats")

title: Introduction to orthoviewer
text: React user interactions:
code: server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$viewer <- renderOrtho_viewer({     ortho_viewer(brain, bg_colormap = "Greys")   })    # React to clicks   observeEvent(input$viewer_click, {     click <- ortho_event(input, "viewer", "click")      # Get coordinates     world <- ortho_world(click)  # in mm     voxel <- ortho_voxel(click)  # indices      # Get intensity at clicked location     intensity <- ortho_intensity(click)      # Check which view was clicked     view <- click$view  # "axial", "coronal", or "sagittal"      # Check modifier keys     if (ortho_modifier(click, "shift")) {       message("Shift-click detected!")     }   }) }

text: Use layer IDs: Always name layers adding can reference later. Threshold appropriately: statistical maps, hide non-significant voxels thresholds (e.g., c(-2, 2) z-scores). Reduce opacity: overlaying multiple maps, lower opacity helps see layers. Use animation sparingly: Smooth transitions nice user-initiated navigation can distracting triggered frequently.
